abstract.p: Japan's Toyota Motor Co will set up research company together with some of its affiliated companies to help them scout for new businesses in realm of information technology and develop them; Toyota has long focused on information about technology as part of its effort to develop 'smart' cars; Kyocera Corp and Denso Corp will also take stake in new company (S)

block.p: Japan's largest car manufacturer, Toyota Motor, will set up a research company together with some of its affiliated companies to help them scout for new businesses in the realm of information technology and develop them. Toyota, which has large cash reserves, has long focused on information technology as part of its effort to develop ''smart'' cars. The Kyocera Corporation, the world's largest maker of ceramic packages for computers, and the Denso Corporation, Toyota's main parts supplier, will also take a stake in the new company.
